actions-list.actionItem: The Speaker announced that the House do now adjourn pursuant to clause 13 of Rule I. The next meeting is scheduled for 9:30 a.m. on June 13, 2025.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.
The House observed a moment of silence in remembrance of the victims of the tragedy at the Pulse Nightclub in Orlando, Florida.
Pursuant to clause 13 of Rule 1, the Chair announced the Speaker's designation of the period from Thursday, June 12, 2025, through Sunday, June 22, 2025, as a "district work period".
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 224
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 205

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 2056 — "To require the District of Columbia to comply with federal immigration laws."

actions-list.header: On motion to adjourn Failed by recorded vote: 206

actions-list.actionItem: Mr. Thompson (CA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 214
On motion to recommit Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 208

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.R. 4 — "To rescind certain budget authority proposed to be rescinded in special messages transmitted to the Congress by the President on June 3, 2025, in accordance with section 1012(a) of the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 321

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. S. 331 — "To amend the Controlled Substances Act with respect to the scheduling of fentanyl-related substances, and for other purposes."

The Chair announced that the unfinished business was the question on passage of S. 331, on motion to recommit H.R. 4, on passage of the bill, if ordered, on motion to recommit H.R. 2056, and on passage of the bill, if ordered, which had been debated earlier and on which further proceedings had been postponed.

At the conclusion of debate on H.R. 4, the Chair put the question on motion to recommit and by voice vote, announced that the noes had prevailed. Ms. Kelly (IL) demanded the yeas and nays and the Chair postponed further proceedings until a time to be announced.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered pursuant to clause 2(b) of rule XIX.
Ms. Kelly (IL) moved to recommit to the Committee on Appropriations.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.R. 4.
Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 4 with 1 hour of general debate. Motion to recommit allowed. Bill is closed to amendments.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 499. H.R. 4 — "To rescind certain budget authority proposed to be rescinded in special messages transmitted to the Congress by the President on June 3, 2025, in accordance with section 1012(a) of the Congressional Budget and Impoundment Control Act of 1974."
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is subject to the call of the Chair.

The House received a communication from the Honorable Sam Graves, Chairman, Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure. Pursuant to section 3307 of Title 40, United States Code, Mr. Graves notified the Speaker that on June 11, 2025, the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure met in open session and adopted 30 resolutions included in the General Services Administration's Capital Investment and Leasing Programs. Copies of the resolutions adopted by the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure were enclosed. Referred to the Committee on Appropriations.
The House proceeded with one minute speeches, which by direction of the Chair would be limited to 15 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Ms. Garcia of TX to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Rev. Paul Shaughnessy, S.J., St. Cecilia Church, Leominster, Massachusetts
The House convened, returning from a recess continuing the legislative day of June 12.
The Speaker announced that the House do now recess. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 P.M. today.
The House proceeded with Morning-Hour Debate. At the conclusion of Morning-Hour, the House will recess until 12:00 p.m. for the start of legislative business.
The Speaker designated the Honorable Ralph Norman to act as Speaker pro tempore for today.
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
